name: omon

body.origin:
|- wo(wcel(com, con0), wceq(com, con0))
-| word(com)
-| wb(word(com), wo(wcel(com, con0), wceq(com, con0)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wo(wcel(com, con0), wceq(com, con0))
-| word(com)
-| wb(word(com), wo(wcel(com, con0), wceq(com, con0)))

|- wo(wcel(com, con0), wceq(com, con0))
-| wb(word(com), wo(wcel(com, con0), wceq(com, con0)))

comment: The class of natural numbers ` _om ` is either an ordinal number (if we accept the Axiom of Infinity) or the proper class of all ordinal numbers (if we deny the Axiom of Infinity). Remark in [TakeutiZaring] p. 43. (Contributed by NM, 10-May-1998.)
